alert.note: Alert for Rota; Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued January 10 at 6:04AM ChST until January 15 at 6:00PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 6 AM CHST EARLY THIS MORNING... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK WILL EXPIRE AT 6 AM CHST EARLY THIS MORNING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THURSDAY TO 6 PM CHST SUNDAY ALONG NORTH FACING REEFS... ...HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON ALONG NORTH FACING REEFS... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, surf has currently diminished below advisory criteria, so the advisory is being allowed to expire. However, around Thursday, it will build back to between 9 and 13 feet along north facing reefs. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...North facing reefs of the Marianas. * WHEN...For the first High Surf Advisory and High Rip Current Risk, until 6 AM Tuesday. For the second High Surf Advisory and High Rip Current Risk, from early Thursday morning to Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
